ios.name: iPhone / iPad
steps: Open the Voice Memos app (pre-installed on all iOS devices)
Tap the red record button to start recording
Place your device 6-12 inches from the speaker for optimal quality
Tap stop when finished
Tap the recording to rename it
Tap the share button and select 'Save to Files' or upload directly to our site
tips: Use a quiet room with minimal echo
Consider using AirPods or external mic for better quality

android.name: Android
steps: Open your default Voice Recorder app (or download one from Play Store)
Tap the record button to start
Hold your phone 6-12 inches from the speaker
Tap stop when finished
Save the recording with a descriptive name
Share via email, cloud storage, or upload directly to our site
tips: Turn on 'Do Not Disturb' mode to avoid interruptions
Use the phone's bottom microphone for better pickup
Keep the device steady during recording

mac.name: Mac
steps: Open QuickTime Player (found in Applications folder)
Go to File > New Audio Recording
Click the red record button
Position yourself 1-2 feet from the built-in microphone
Click stop when finished
Save the file (File > Save) and upload to our site
tips: Use an external USB microphone for professional quality
Close other applications to avoid notification sounds
Record in a room with soft furnishings to reduce echo

apps.name: GarageBand
apps.description: Advanced features for music and podcasting

windows.name: Windows PC
steps: Open Voice Recorder app (search for it in Start menu)
Click the microphone button to start recording
Speak clearly into your computer's microphone
Click stop when finished
The recording will be saved automatically
Right-click the recording to find the file location and upload
tips: Use a USB headset for better audio quality
Close browser tabs and other apps to reduce background noise
Position the microphone away from keyboard and mouse
